A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I decided to add my review to this movie because I saw too many five star reviews that say something to the effect of “don’t believe the fanboys and diversity haters”... I am not a fanboy at all\, I’ve seen all the Star Wars movies because I am a movie buff but I’ve never been a big fan\, and I’ve always thought that even the best Star Wars movies were just pretty good. Still\, I appreciate what the franchise’s mythology means in our pop culture and I’ve always respected how the films do maintain a nice balance between fantastical science fiction and relatable characters and storylines. The biggest problem with this film -in my opinion- is simply how ridiculously unbelievable the narrative is\, it’s full of nonsensical plot holes and overall it just feels like ‘who cares about any of this’. Maybe a new generation of viewers will care about it\, but me personally\, you can’t insult my intelligence and expect me to hang in there for future installments. For Disney’s sake\, I hope there’s enough of these young kids and older audience members worldwide who like the mindless direction they’re taking this franchise. I won’t be watching anymore of them\, this movie was that bad. Maybe in the future if there’s a whole new storyline with completely new and unrelated characters\, I might check out a movie when it comes to Netflix just out of curiosity about what they’re doing with it...The Last Jedi was exhaustingly awful\, like the worst of the previous installments (Phantom Menace would be my choice for second worst) but on top of being bad it was also completely full of holes and wtf bs moments and more yawn-inducing dead-behind-the-eyes pointlessness. I was hopeful because I like Rian Johnson’s other films\, but however it happened\, this movie came out a giant turkey that left me with the feeling that the soul of the original Star Wars has been officially and irreversibly snuffed out. The End.
